title: Hello World
content:
Welcome to Hexo! This is your very first post. Check documentation for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in troubleshooting or you can ask me on GitHub.
Quick StartCreate a new post$ hexo new "My New Post"

More info: Writing
Run server$ hexo server

More info: Server
Generate static files$ hexo generate

More info: Generating
Deploy to remote sites$ hexo deploy

More info: Deployment

title: not, but
content:
æŒç»­æ›´æ–°ä¸­â€¦
not, butnot same, but somorphism.not implementation, but interface.not instance, but class.not variable, but struct.not semblance, but manifestation.semblancerepresentationperformanceappearencephenomenonshow


Tractatus Logico-philosophicus by [Ludwig Josef Johann Wittgenstein]


not reasonable, but occur.

not thing, but fact.


not whole, but part.

not molecule, but atom.
not accidental, but inherent.
not extrinsic, but intrinsic.
not imagine, but common.
not property, but form.
not object, but configuration.
not substance, but structure.
not causal, but Independent.
not graph, but display.


not thought, but image.

not self, but other.
not words, but proposition.
not tones, but melody.
not design, but describe.
not point, but arrow.
not what, but how.
not one, but only one.
not define, but initial.
not variable, but regulation.
not symbol, but notation.
not nature, but logic.
not notation, but form.
not special, but common.
not combination, but designation.


not true or false, but meaningless.

not philosophy, but natural science.

not doubt, but negate.

not believe, but prove.

not prove, but assert.

not describe, but keep silent.



The Zen of Python, by Tim Peters

not true or false, but good and bad.

not lucky, but happy.

not say, but do.

not later, but now.

not right now, but mull.

not code, but demand.

not repeat, but once.

not strict, but compat.

Not ugliness, but beauty.

not implicit, but explicit.

not complex, but simple.

not complicated, but complex.

not nest, but flat.

not dense, but sparse.

not performance, but readability.

not purity, but practicality.

not second, but first.

not one, but more.

not more, but best.

not best, but better.

not help, but self.

not teach, but learn.

not copy, but imitation.



Explicit is better than implicit.Simple is better than complex.Complex is better than complicated.Flat is better than nested.Sparse is better than dense.Readability counts.Special cases aren't special enough to break the rules.Although practicality beats purity.Errors should never pass silently.Unless explicitly silenced.In the face of ambiguity, refuse the temptation to guess.There should be one-- and preferably only one --obvious way to do it.Although that way may not be obvious at first unless you're Dutch.Now is better than never.Although never is often better than _right_ now.If the implementation is hard to explain, it's a bad idea.If the implementation is easy to explain, it may be a good idea.Namespaces are one honking great idea -- let's do more of those!
